computing_skills wrote:
> 
> 
> This is the first time I've used Junit and could appreciate some
> help in debugging a problem.
> 
> I have a number of Java classes which extend TestCase and contain the
> methods I'm testing.
> 
> I've also have one TestSuite which is along the lines of
> 
>      suite = new TestSuite("All Data Load Tests");
>       suite.addTest(new AdaptorsTestCase1("DaoBlaiseFields_create"));
>       suite.addTest(new AdaptorsTestCase1
> ("DaoBlaiseFields_createAnswerData"));
>       suite.addTest(new AdaptorsTestCase1
> ("DaoBlaiseFields_createSpecialAnswers"));
>       etc.
> 
> Am trying to TestRunner (the swing version).
> 
> When I do run it, I'm getting a message  that it cannot find any
> tests, what am I missing?
> 
> I thought I  followed the demo(s) on junit.org

Try reading JUnit: A Starter Guide, which you can find quickly using Google.

We need to see the complete command you're using to run JUnit to 
determine the problem. It could be a number of things: bad class path, 
bad test class name, and so on. Show us the command you're using to run 
JUnit and the content of your CLASSPATH variable.

Thanks.
--
